item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "I would always rather be happy than dignified." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Mocking a woman is like drinking too much wine. It may be fun for a short time, but the hangover is hell." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Herm Albright
item.description: "A positive attitude may not solve all your problems, but it will annoy enough people to make it worth the effert." -- Herm Albright

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "I like nonsense, it wakes up the brain cells. Fantasy is a necessary ingredient in living." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Whenever you find yourself on the side of the majority, it is time to pause and reflect." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "That which does not kill us makes us stronger." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "I love deadlines. I love the whooshing noise they make as they go by." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Miss Piggy
item.description: "Beauty is in the eye of the beholder and it may be necessary from time to time to give a stupid or misinformed beholder a black eye." -- Miss Piggy

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You don’t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Abraham Lincoln
item.description: "Folks are usually about as happy as they make their minds up to be." -- Abraham Lincoln

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Lloyd Alexander
item.description: "Fantasy is hardly an escape from reality. It's a way of understanding it." -- Lloyd Alexander

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Judith Viorst
item.description: "Strength is the capacity to break a Hershey bar into four pieces with your bare hands - and then eat just one of the pieces." -- Judith Viorst

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Steve Martin
item.description: "Some people have a way with words, and other people...oh, uh, not have way." -- Steve Martin

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Samuel Lover
item.description: "Circumstances are the rulers of the weak; they are but the instruments of the wise." -- Samuel Lover

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Charles Lamb
item.description: "Tis the privilege of friendship to talk nonsense, and to have her nonsense respected." -- Charles Lamb

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Literature is a textually transmitted disease, normally contracted in childhood." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Galileo Galilei
item.description: "I have never met a man so ignorant that I couldn't learn something from him." -- Galileo Galilei

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description:
"You see, that is the sad, sorry, terrible thing about sarcasm.
It's really funny." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "My behavior is nonetheless, deplorable. Unfortunately, I'm quite prone to such bouts of deplorability--take for instance, my fondness for reading books at the dinner table." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "She’s only seventeen years old,” Llarimar said. “I can’t imagine being married to the God King at her age.” “I can’t imagine you being married to the God King at any age, Scoot,” Lightsong said. Then he pointedly cringed. “Actually, yes I can imagine it, and the dress looks painfully inelegant on you. Make a note to have my imagination flogged for its insolence in showing me that par tic u lar sight.” “I’ll put it in line right behind your sense of decorum, Your Grace,” Llarimar said dryly. “Don’t be silly,” Lightsong said, taking a sip of wine. “I haven’t had one of those in years." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "I like words. And I always learn a few new ones when Father gets angry. I shouldn't neglect my education, now should I?" -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Definitely not-you optimists just can't understand that a depressed person doesn't want you to try and cheer them up.It makes us sick." Brandon Sanderson(Elantris)" -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by Brandon Sanderson
item.description: "Stop moping, sule," galladon said with a grunt."It doesn't suit you-it takes a fine sense of pessimism to brood with any sort of respectability." -- Brandon Sanderson

item.title: MightiMidget add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "If we find ourselves with a desire that nothing in this world can satisfy, the most probable explanation is that we were made for another world." -- C.S. Lewis
